title.narrative: Building Sustainability Mechanism for Community Resiliency: A follow-up project to Building Disaster-Resilient Communities after Typhoon Yolanda

description.narrative:
The recommended project is a follow-up of UUSC's first grant to the organization. It is aimed at ensuring that the gains of the first project in livelihood recovery, human rights promotion and protection, trauma resilience will be sustained and advanced through building and strengthening social mechanisms such as community organizations of women, indigenous peoples, farmers and fishers, ensuring their participation and that their issues are addressed in local governance, and their plans are integrated in the development plans and budgets of the local government units.
Grantee mission: To transform and empower the deprived sectors in Region VI to increasingly take control of their own destinies towards improved quality of life through community organizing.
